title: Jordan B Peterson and the Tribe of No-Tribe, Outsourcing the Problem, Chaos and Complexity
description:
Jordan Peterson and The Tribe of No-Tribe

Iain McGilchrist essay:  https://www.amazon.com/Divided-Brain-Search-Meaning-ebook/dp/B008JE7I2M
Jeremy Firth YouTube channel:  https://www.youtube.com/user/jeremyfirth
Paul’s marriage video with Guy Sengstock:  https://youtu.be/qMyACsMlNMs
Karen Wong’s websites:  
https://TheMeaningCode.com, 
https://karenwongart.com

Jeremy came to faith after time as an agnostic.
Looking for a balance in the binaries:
Classical (systems oriented) + Romantic (aesthetic)
L Hemisphere + R Hemisphere
Frame + Dust
Recipe + Flour
Intentions (heaven) + Material (earth)

Growing up in a chaotic household led to building a buffer from comedy or intellect.
Comedy framework;
First a proposition, then something matches the pattern, then something breaks the pattern
Adapting to anomaly updates the prediction model.

We are a complex system within complex systems
Hard to draw a boundary around a person.
Drawing a boundary both separates a thing from other things, and unites a thing with itself,
Gives it a purpose, a telos
Because of Jordan Peterson, it’s a distributed problem that we are all working on.
We are the Tribe of No Tribe.
Not a book waiting to be written but a movement ready to take place.

Technology both enables/empowers us (good) and makes us more dependent/vulnerable (bad)
Happy and complete is not the goal.

Self-educated
Got interested in chaos theory because of his role in manufacturing.
Works at a custom fabrication shop, a one off, unique design.
Chaos theory is theoretically deterministic but has too many variables to be functionally predictive and is sensitive to initial conditions.
Complexity theory has feedback loops, is not sensitive to initial conditions.

Chaos Theory connects to fractals and to the Pareto distribution
Fractals are infinite in either direction, but the scale of the variance always stays the same.
So, the average is always wrong
Chaotic systems stack up to produce complex systems, feedback the results (genetic algorithms)
Traditional statistics are based on linear algebra, but Bayesian prediction is recursive, and based on probability.

Jeremy is a Business Intelligence engineer.
